scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is entering.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Guys? There's a somebody I'd like you to meet.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oooh!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: W-wait. What is that?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: 'That' would be Marcel. You wanna say hi?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, no, I don't.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, he is precious! Where did you get him?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: My friend Bethel rescued him from some lab.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: That is so cruel! Why? Why would a parent name their child Bethel?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, that monkey's got a Ross on its ass!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ross, is he gonna live with you, like, in your apartment?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah. I mean, it's been kinda quiet since Carol left, so...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why don't you just get a roommate?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Nah, I dunno... I think you reach a certain age, having a roommate is kinda pathe- (Realises) ....sorry, that's, that's 'pathet', which is Sanskrit for 'really cool way to live'.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is getting ready to sing. Joey is not there.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So you guys, I'm doing all new material tonight. I have twelve new songs about my mother's suicide, and one about a snowman.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Might wanna open with the snowman.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey, Joey. Hey, buddy.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So, how'd it go?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ahhhhhh, I didn't get the job.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: How could you not get it? You were Santa last year.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I dunno. Some fat guy's sleeping with the store manager. He's not even jolly, it's all political.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So what are you gonna be?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ah, I'm gonna be one of his helpers. It's just such a slap in the face, y'know?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey, do you guys know what you're doing for New Year's? (They all protest and hit her with cushions) Gee, what?! What is wrong with New Year's?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Nothing for you, you have Paolo. You don't have to face the hor

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, for your information, Paolo is gonna be in Rome this New Year, so I'll be just as pathetic as the rest of you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, you wish!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: It's just that I'm sick of being a victim of this Dick Clark holiday. I say this year, no dates, we make a pact. Just the six of us- dinner.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yeah, okay. Alright.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know, I was hoping for a little more enthusiasm.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Woooo! Yeah!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Phoebe, you're on.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, oh, good.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (Into microphone) Okay, hi. Ladies and gentlemen, back by popular demand, Miss Phoebe Buffay. Wooh!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (Takes mike) Thanks, hi. Um, I wanna start with a song that means a lot to me this time of year. (Shakes

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (Sung)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (Sung)

dialogue.speaker: MAX
dialogue.text: No. No, that's- that's okay.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, c'mon, if it's important enough to discuss while I'm playing, then I assume it's important enough for everyone else to hear!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (Quietly, to the others) That guy's going home with a note!

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: Noth- I was- I was just saying to my-

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Could you speak up please?

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: (Stands up and speaks more loudly) Sorry, I wa- I was just saying to my friend that I thought you were the most beautiful woman that I'd ever seen in my- in my life. And then he said that- you said you thought

dialogue.speaker: MAX
dialogue.text: Daryl Hannah.

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: Daryl Hannah was the most beautiful woman that he'd ever seen in his life and I said yeah, I liked her in Splash, a lot, but not so much in- in Wall Street, I thought she had kind of a

dialogue.speaker: MAX
dialogue.text: Hard quality.

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: -hard quality. And uh, while Daryl Hannah is beautiful in a conventional way, you are luminous with a kind of a delicate grace. Then, uh, that-that-that's when you started yelling. (Sits down)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, we're gonna take a short break. (Goes over to their table)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, that guy's going home with more than a note!

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone except Joey is decorating for Christmas.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Come here, Marcel. Sit here. (Marcel wanders off)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Pheebs, I can't believe he hasn't kissed you yet. I mean God, by my sixth date with Paolo, I mean he had already named both my breasts! ...Ooh. Did I just share too much?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Just a smidge.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: David's like, y'know, Scientist Guy. He's very methodical.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I think it's romantic.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Me too! Oh! Did you ever see An Officer and a Gentleman?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, he's kinda like the guy I went to see that with. Except, except he-he's smarter, and gentler, and sweeter... I just- I just wanna be with him all the time. Day and night, and night and day... and special occasions...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Wait a minute, wait a minute, I see where this is going, you're gonna ask him to New Year's, aren't you. You're gonna break the pact. She's gonna break the pact.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, no, no, no, no, no. Yeah, could I just?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, 'cause I already asked Janice.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: C'mon, this was a pact! This was your pact!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I snapped, okay? I couldn't handle the pressure and I snapped.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, but Janice? That-that was like the worst breakup in history!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm not saying it was a good idea, I'm saying I snapped!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hi. Hi, sorry I'm late.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Too many jokes... must mock Joey!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Nice shoes, huh? (He wiggles his foot and the bells tinkle)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Aah, y'killing me!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ross! He's playing with my spatulas again!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, look, he's not gonna hurt them, right?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Do you always have to bring him here?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I didn't wanna leave him alone. Alright? We- we had our first fight this morning. I think it has to do with my working late. I said some things that I didn't mean, and he- he threw some faeces...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know, if you're gonna work late, I could look in on him for you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, that'd be great! Okay, but if you do, make sure it seems like you're there to see him, okay, and you're not like doing it as a favour to me.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, but if he asks, I'm not going to lie.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Max and David's lab, David is explaining something to Phoebe with the aid of a
whiteboard.]

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: ...But, you can't actually test this theory, because today's particle accelerators are nowhere near powerful enough to simulate these conditions.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, alright, I have a question, then.

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: Yuh.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, were you planning on kissing me ever?

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: Uh, that's definitely a, uh, valid question. And, uh, the answer would be (Writes YES on the board) yes. Yes I was. But, see, I wanted it to be this phenomenal kiss that happened at this phenomenal moment, because, well, 'cause it's you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Sure.

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: Right. But, see, the longer I waited, the more phenomenal the kiss had to be, and now we've reached a place where it's just gotta be one of those things where I just like... sweep everything off the table and throw you down on it. And, uh, I'm not really a, uh, sweeping sorta fella.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, David, I, I think you are a sweeping sorta fella. I mean, you're a sweeper! ...trapped inside a physicist's body.

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: Rrrreally.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, oh, I'm sure of it. You should just do it, just sweep and throw me.

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: ...Now? Now?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, right now.

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: Okay, okay, okay. (Gets ready to sweep, and then picks up a laptop computer) Y'know what, this was just really expensive. (Puts it down elsewhere. Then picks up a microscope) And I'll take- this was a gift. (Moves it)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, now you're just kinda tidying.

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: Okay, what the hell, what the hell. (Sweeps the remaining papers off the desk and grabs Phoebe) You want me to actually throw you or you-you wanna just hop?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I can hop. (She hops onto the table)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So tell me something. What does the phrase 'no date pact' mean to you?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, okay. It's just that Chandler has somebody, and Phoebe has somebody- I thought I'd ask Fun Bobby.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Fun Bobby? Your ex-boyfriend Fun Bobby?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You know more than one Fun Bobby?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I happen to know a Fun Bob.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (Brings Joey a mug of coffee) Okay, here we go...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ooh ooh ooh ooh, there's no room for milk!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (Glances at Joey and then sips his coffee) There. Now there is.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, so on our no-date evening, three of you now have dates.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Uh, four.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Four.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Five.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Five. (Buries his head in his hands)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Sorry. Paolo's catching an earlier flight.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, and I met this really hot single mom at the store. What's an elf to do?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, so I'm gonna be the only one standing there alone when the ball drops?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, c'mon. We'll have, we'll have a big party, and no-one'll know who's with who.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, y'know, this is so not what I needed right now.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What's the matter?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, it's-it's Marcel. He keeps shutting me out, y'know? He's walking around all the time dragging his hands...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That's so weird, I had such a blast with him the other night.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Really.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, we played, we watched TV.. that juggling thing is amazing.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What, uh... what juggling thing?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: With the balled-up socks? I figured you taught him that.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know, it wasn't that big a deal. He just balled up socks... and a melon...

dialogue.speaker: MAX
dialogue.text: Phoebe. Hi.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, hi Max! Hey, do you know everybody?

dialogue.speaker: MAX
dialogue.text: No. Have you seen David?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, no, he hasn't been around.

dialogue.speaker: MAX
dialogue.text: Well, if you see him, tell him to pack his bags. We are going to Minsk.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Minsk?

dialogue.speaker: MAX
dialogue.text: Minsk. It's in Russia.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I know where Minsk is.

dialogue.speaker: MAX
dialogue.text: We got the grant. Three years, all expenses paid.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So when, when do you leave?

dialogue.speaker: MAX
dialogue.text: January first.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Max and David's lab, they are working. Phoebe knocks on the door]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hello?

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: Hi! (Kisses her) What-what're you doing here?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, well, Max told me about Minsk, so (Puts on a fake cheery voice) congratulations! This is so exciting!

dialogue.speaker: MAX
dialogue.text: It'd be even more exciting if we were going.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, you're not going? (Fake disappointed voice) Oh, why?

dialogue.speaker: MAX
dialogue.text: Tell her, David. 'I don't wanna go to Minsk and work with Lifson and Yamaguchi and Flench, on nonononononono. I wanna stay here and make out with my girlfriend!!' (Storms out)

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: Thank you, Max. Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So-so you're really not going?

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: I don't know. I don't know what I'm gonna do. I just- you decide.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh don't do that.

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: Please.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh no no.

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: No, but I'm asking-

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, but I can't do that-

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: No, but I can't-

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: It's your thing, and-

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: -make the decision-

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, um, stay.

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: Stay.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Stay.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Getting so good at that! (She hops on)

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: It was Max's stuff. (They kiss)

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the party has started.]

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: I love this artichoke thing! Oh, don't tell me what's in it, the diet starts tomorrow! (Laughs her Janice laugh)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You remember Janice.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Vividly.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: SANDY
dialogue.text: Hi, I'm Sandy.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Sandy! Hi! C'mon in! (She enters, followed by a young boy and a younger girl)...You brought your kids.

dialogue.speaker: SANDY
dialogue.text: Yeah. That's okay, right?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Par-tay!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That thing is not coming in here.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: 'That thing'? This is how you greet guests at a party? Let me ask you something, if I showed up here with my new girlfriend, she wouldn't be welcome in your home?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm guessing your new girlfriend wouldn't urinate on my coffee table.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay. He was more embarrassed about that than anyone. Okay? And for him to have the courage to walk back in here like nothing happened...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Alright. Just keep him away from me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thank you. (She walks off) C'mon, Marcel, whaddya say you and I do a little mingling? (Marcel runs off) Alright, I'll, uh... catch up with you later.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my gosh! Rachel, honey.. are you okay? Where-where's Paolo?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Rome. Jerk missed his flight.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: And then... your face is bloated?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No. Okay. I was at the airport, getting into a cab, when this woman- this blonde planet with a pocketbook- starts yelling at me. Something about how it was her cab first. And then the next thing I know she just starts- starts pulling me out by my hair! So I'm blowing my attack whistle thingy and three more cabs show up, and as I'm going to get into a cab she tackles me. And I hit my head on the kerb and cut my lip on my whistle...oh...everybody having fun at the party? (To Monica) Are people eating my dip?

dialogue.speaker: SANDY
dialogue.text: Y'know, when I saw you at the store last week, it was probably the first time I ever mentally undressed an elf.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Wow, that's, uh, dirty.

dialogue.speaker: SANDY
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, kids...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (Watching Marcel play with Phoebe. To Chandler) Look at him. I'm not saying he has to spend the whole evening with me, but at least check in.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: (Startles them) There you are! Haaah, you got away from me!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (Imitating) But you found me!

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Here, Ross, take our picture. (Hands him a camera and he starts snapping) Smile! You're on Janice Camera!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Kill me. Kill me now.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey everybody! It's Fun Bobby!

dialogue.speaker: FUN BOBBY
dialogue.text: Hey, sorry I'm late. But my, uh, grandfather, he- died about two hours ago. But I-I-I couldn't get a flight out 'til tomorrow, so here I am!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (Approaching) Hey Fun Bobby! Whoah! Who died?

dialogue.speaker: FUN BOBBY
dialogue.text: It's gonna be an open casket, y'know, so at least I'll- I get to see him again.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: (Ross is still taking their photo) Oh, I'm gonna blow this one up, and I'm gonna write 'Reunited' in glitter.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Alright, Janice, that's it! Janice... Janice... Hey, Janice, when I invited you to this party I didn't necessarily think that it meant that we-

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Oh, no. Oh, no.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm sorry you misunderstood...

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Oh my God. You listen to me, Chandler, you listen to me. One of these times is just gonna be your last chance with me. (She runs off)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, will you give me the thing. (Snatches the camera)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hi, Max!

dialogue.speaker: MAX
dialogue.text: Yoko. (To David) I've decided to go to Minsk without you.

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: Wow.

dialogue.speaker: MAX
dialogue.text: It won't be the same- but it'll still be Minsk. Happy New Year.(Walks off)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Are you alright?

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: Yeah, I'm fine, I'm fine.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You're going to Minsk.

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: No, I'm... not going to Minsk.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, you are so going to Minsk. You belong in Minsk. You can't stay here just 'cause of me.

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: Yes I can. Because if I go it means I have to break up with you, and I can't break up with you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh yes, yes, yes you can. Just say, um, 'Phoebe, my work is my life and that's what I have to do right now'. And I say 'your work?! Your work?! How can you say that?!'. And then you say, um, 'it's tearing me apart, but I have no choice. Can't you understand that?'. And I say (Hits him) 'no! No! I can't understand that!'.

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: Uh, ow.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ooh, sorry. Um, and, and then you put your arms around me. And then you put your arms around me. (He does so) And, um, and then you tell me that you love me and you'll never forget me.

dialogue.speaker: DAVID
dialogue.text: I'll never forget you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: And then you say that it's almost midnight and you have to go because you don't wanna start the new year with me if you can't finish it. (They kiss) I'm gonna miss you. You scientist guy.

dialogue.speaker: DICK CLARK
dialogue.text: (on TV) Hi, this is Dick Clark, live in Times Square. We're in a virtual snowstorm of confetti here in Times Square...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: There y'go, kids.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (To a woman who he has clearly just met) And then the peacock bit me. (Laughs) Please kiss me at midnight. (She leaves)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You seen Sandy?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ooh. Uh, I don't know how to tell you this, but she's in Monica's bedroom, getting it on with Max, that scientist geek. Ooh, look at that, I did know how to tell you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Vrrbddy, the bll is drrbing.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: (in the kitchen) What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: The bll is drrbing!

dialogue.speaker: DICK CLARK
dialogue.text: (on TV) In twenty seconds it'll be midnight...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And the moment of joy is upon us.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Looks like that no date pact thing worked out.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Everybody looks so happy. I hate that.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Not everybody's happy. Hey Bobby!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know, I uh.. just thought I'd throw this out here. I'm no math whiz, but I do believe there are three girls and three guys right here. (Makes kiss noise)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I dunno. I don't feel like kissing anyone tonight.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I can't kiss anyone.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So I'm kissing everyone?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Nonono, you can't kiss Ross, that's your brother.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Perfect. Perfect. So now everybody's getting kissed but me.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Alright, somebody kiss me. Somebody kiss me, it's midnight! Somebody kiss me!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Alrightalrightalright. (Kisses him. Ross takes a photo) There.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (Watching Marcel and talking to Rachel) I wanted this to work so much. I mean I'm still in there, changing his diapers, pickin' his fleas... but he's just phoning it in. Just so hard to accept the fact that something you love so much doesn't love you back.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: ...I think that bitch cracked my tooth.
